intro: Cynometra schefferi var. schefferi, commonly known as the African tamarind tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody pods containing edible seeds. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a source of food, while the tree is also valued for its timber. The plant is adapted to dry and semi-arid climates, making it resilient to drought conditions.
